lst.name: sentence
lst.str: Brokers said their optimism about the market was based on the current low interest rates, the increasing propensity of the Japanese to save as the economy stagnates, the imminent introduction of taxes on traditionally untaxed post office savings and the allure of quick and easy profits from stocks.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: President Reagan's threat to impose tariffs on Japanese electronics exports because of Japan's alleged refusal to abide by a bilateral agreement on computer chips, was unlikely to cause the market to crash, the brokers said on the eve of the new fiscal year starting April 1.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: Brokers said they believe there would be more reports in the coming year of scientific discoveries to combat or diagnose Aquired Immune Deficiency Syndrome (AIDS), and these would propel related companies' shares even higher than they had risen already.
